'''Lofar''' was a [[Dwarves|Dwarf]] in early drafts of ''[[The Fellowship of the Ring]]''. He was one of the Dwarves that stayed at [[Bag End]] after [[Bilbo Baggins]]' [[Bilbo's Farewell Party|birthday party]].<ref name=":0">{{RS|Return}}</ref>

== History ==
In the early writings of the chapter "[[A Long-expected Party]]", Lofar was instructed by Bilbo to give the [[The One Ring|Ring]] to [[Frodo Baggins]] (at that point called "Bingo").<ref name=":0" /> Lofar is not named in the published version of The Fellowship of the Ring however he may be one of three Dwarves that sets out with Bilbo for [[Rivendell]].<ref>{{FR|Party}}, p. 35</ref>

== Etymology ==
''Lofarr'' is a dwarf from the ''[[Völuspá|Dvergatal]]''. It can mean either "Stooper" or "Praiser".<ref>Chester Nathan Gould, "Dwarf-Names: A Study in Old Icelandic Religion", published in ''Publications of the Modern Language Association of America'', Vol 44 (1929), issue #4, pp. 939-967</ref>
